meanings.definition: The quality or state of being harsh.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's harshness towards the students made them afraid to ask questions.
meanings.sent2: The harshness of the winter wind made everyone bundle up in warm clothes.
meanings.sent3: The harshness of the alarm clock in the morning always startles me awake.
meanings.sent4: The harshness of reality hit him like a ton of bricks when he failed the exam.
meanings.sent5: The harshness of the judge's sentence left the defendant in tears.

meanings.definition: Roughness or severity in manner or treatment.
meanings.sent1: His harshness in criticizing others often hurt their feelings.
meanings.sent2: The manager's harshness towards employees led to a high turnover rate.
meanings.sent3: The harshness of the chef's critique on the dish made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The harshness of the punishment shocked the students into better behavior.
meanings.sent5: The harshness of the storm caused damage to the fragile crops.

meanings.definition: Unpleasantly rough or jarring to the senses.
meanings.sent1: The harshness of the fabric irritated her sensitive skin.
meanings.sent2: The music producer toned down the harshness of the sound for a smoother listening experience.
meanings.sent3: The harshness of the lighting in the room made it difficult to relax.
meanings.sent4: The harshness of the soap left her hands feeling dry and rough.
meanings.sent5: The harshness of the smell coming from the garbage can made her hold her nose.
